intro: Phaca tejonensis, commonly known as Tejon's phaca, is a rare flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its fern-like leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions. Its blooming period occurs in the spring, producing delicate white or pale yellow flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
